title: MySQLLOWER()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLLOWER()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Convert the text to lower-case:
SELECT LOWER("SQL Tutorial is FUN!");

Definition and Usage
The LOWER() function converts a string to lower-case.
Note:
The
LCASE()
function is equal to the LOWER() function.
Syntax
LOWER(
text
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
text
Required. The string to convert
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Convert the text in "CustomerName" to lower-case:
SELECT LOWER(CustomerName) AS LowercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT LOWER(CustomerName) AS LowercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

quiz.question: What is SQL Tutorial?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of SQL Tutorial is 'FUN'.

quiz.question: What is function?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of function is 'equal to the LOWER() function'.

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLLOWER()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLLOWER()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLLOWER()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
